clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study on Hypothyroidism in Young Children Following Iodine Contrast Exposure
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study on Hypothyroidism in Young Children Following Iodine Contrast Exposure

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the incidence of detected hypothyroidism after iodinated contrast exposure in pediatric patients from birth to 3 years of age (inclusive) in a routine clinical practice setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Pediatric Patients With Detected Hypothyroidism After Iodinated Contrast Exposure in a Routine Clinical Practice Setting
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to one year after iodinated contrast material (ICM) exposure (828 person years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Characteristics (Sex) of the Cases With Hypothyroidism and of the Rest of the Cohort
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to one year after ICM exposure (828 person years)

arm_group.description: children age 0-3 years (inclusive), who underwent a iodine contrast enhanced radiological examination.

study_pop.textblock: Members of Maccabi Health Services database (Israel)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All children age 0-3 years (inclusive) who are identified of having undergone a radiological examination with intravascular use of an iodinated contrast agent.(e.g.
contrast enhanced CT, cardioangiography)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Congenital Hypothyroidism or other forms of preexisting hypothyroidism
- Preexisting thyroid hormone replacement therapy less than three months of observation before the radiological examination (if greater than three months old)
- Less than two weeks follow-up available after the contrast exposure.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was a retrospective cohort study, using the data from the years 1998 until 2015 in the database of Maccabi Health Services (Israel).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Between 1.1.1998 and 31.12.2015, 877 participants were identified. After applying exclusion criteria, 34 participants were excluded from the initial cohort and the final cohort consisted of 843 participants.

group.title: Iodine Contrast Agent
group.description: The data used for this retrospective cohort study was from the years 1998 until 2015. The study population consisted of children ages 0-3 (inclusive) who have undergone a radiological examination with an iodinated contrast agent (contrast enhanced CT and cardio-angiography). Follow-up for the outcome (hypothyroidism) was for up to one year after contrast exposure. Incident cases of hypothyroidism were detected by: thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) levels, coded diagnosis of hypothyroidism or start of new thyroid replacement therapy.

Follow-up for the outcome (hypothyroidism) was for up to one year after contrast exposure. Incident cases of hypothyroidism were detected by: TSH levels, coded diagnosis of hypothyroidism or start of new thyroid replacement therapy.

outcome.title: The Duration of Hypothyroidism Episode in the âProbable Iodine Inducedâ Category
outcome.description: Based on the information collected from the database, the probable longest duration of Hypothyroidism was ascertained for the cases below.
outcome.time_frame: Up to one year after ICM exposure (828 person years)
outcome.population: Probable iodine-induced hypothyroidism: (N=8) included all potential cases of hypothyroidism with no other cause than the previous ICM exposure could be identified.

group.title: Probable Iodine-induced Hypothyroidism
group.description: Included all potential cases of hypothyroidism with no other cause than the previous ICM exposure could be identified.

reported_events.time_frame: Up to one year after contrast exposure.
reported_events.desc: This study is a retrospective study using data from the database in Israel. The safety outcome focused on the incidence of hypothyroidism for up to one year after iodine contrast exposure, detected by: TSH levels, coded diagnosis of hypothyroidism or start of new thyroid replacement therapy. Please refer to the result of primary outcome measure.

group.title: Iodine Contrast Agent
group.description: The data used for this retrospective cohort study was from the years 1998 until 2015. The study population consisted of children ages 0-3 (inclusive) who have undergone a radiological examination with an iodinated contrast agent (contrast enhanced CT and cardio-angiography). Follow-up for the outcome (hypothyroidism) was for up to one year after contrast exposure. Incident cases of hypothyroidism were detected by: TSH levels, coded diagnosis of hypothyroidism or start of new thyroid replacement therapy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study is a retrospective database analysis study. The safety outcome focused on the incidence of hypothyroidism for up to one year after iodine contrast exposure. Please refer to the result of primary outcome measure for safety evaluation.
